text: The George Washington Cable House is a cottage at 1313 8th Street in the Garden District of New Orleans, Louisiana. It was the home of George Washington Cable (1844â€“1925), an American novelist who wrote of Creole life, during the period in which he rose to national prominence. He lived in this home during 1874-1884. The house was declared a National Historic Landmark in 1962. and ==References== Category:National Historic Landmarks of the United States Category:Buildings and structures in New Orleans Category:Houses in the United States Category:1874 establishments in the United States Category:1870s establishments in Louisiana
title: George Washington Cable House
